metadata.title: CVE-2017-11575 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
FontForge 20161012 is vulnerable to a buffer over-read in strnmatch(char.c) resulting in DoS or code execution via a crafted otf file, relatedto a call from the readttfcopyrights function in parsettf.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11575` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

fontforge - 20120731.b-7.1ubuntu0.1
fontforge-common - 20120731.b-7.1ubuntu0.1
fontforge-nox - 20120731.b-7.1ubuntu0.1
libfontforge1 - 20120731.b-7.1ubuntu0.1
libgdraw4 - 20120731.b-7.1ubuntu0.1
python-fontforge - 20120731.b-7.1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fontforge package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '20120731.b-7.1ubuntu0.1').
